newsitem.title: USA: BMC West sees Q2 EPS below analysts' views.
newsitem.headline: BMC West sees Q2 EPS below analysts' views.

text.p: BMC West Corp said Monday that its second quarter results will be lower than analysts' expectations.
It said earnings per share are anticipated to be in the range of $0.28-$0.30 -- less than analysts' earlier consensus estimates on First Call of $0.35.
The building materials distributor also said that sales for the quarter ended June 30 are expected to be below BMC West's internal projections and prior year sales.

"Sales have been slow, particularly in the state of Texas, due primarily to the effect of unusually harsh weather conditions on construction during the quarter," said Ellis C. Goebel, the company's vice president and treasurer.
He said that in addition, overall building permit activity in the 10 western states in which we have operations has been down, slowing the demand for building materials.
The company expects to release its results for the second quarter on July 29, he said.
BMC West currently operates 53 building materials centers in 10 Western states -- Arizona, California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, Utah and Washington.
